ygData.subject: RE: Is the verdict finally in?
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, I find it hard to believe that Verant would be that short sighted to place something as important as bank balance on the desktop. Marc Kazen ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, I find it hard to believe that Verant would be that short sighted to
place something as important as bank balance on the desktop.
Marc Kazen


-----Original Message-----
From: Michael O'Reilly [mailto:michael@...]
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 11:21 AM
To: 'EQCheats@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?

From: Michael O'Reilly <michael@...>

I think not. I play EQ a lot from different computers.
Things I have to
set up on each new computer are hotkeys, friends list, and
ignore list.
However, my character, equipment, bank balance, faction,
current buffs,
and location remain the same.

That indicates to me that all of the second list are on the
server, not
the individual computer.

-----Original Message-----
From: kale usi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 7:28 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: [EQCheats] Is the verdict finally in?


From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>

It's been suggested from a knowledgeable hacker, that
important
information
(such as your characters banking information) is stored
locally on your
hard
drive in a packed file. Has anyone else been able to unpack
any files to

verify/refute this? If this is found to be true, then it
looks as though
EQ
has been hacked like UO.
